incidents.title: File Upload Failures - S3 Permission Denied
incidents.impact: Users unable to upload files. Approximately 500+ users affected. Upload API returning 403 Forbidden errors.
incidents.description: File upload service experiencing 403 Forbidden errors when attempting to upload files to S3 bucket 'acmecorp-uploads'. CloudWatch logs show 'Access Denied' errors. Issue started at 09:15 UTC. Users reporting inability to upload documents.
incidents.root_cause: Under investigation - error logs show S3 access denied but cause not yet determined
timeline: 09:17 - Automatic alerts sent to platform team
09:22 - CloudWatch logs show 403 Forbidden errors from S3
09:25 - Verified S3 bucket exists and service is running
09:30 - Checking for recent deployments or configuration changes
09:35 - Current status: investigating cause of access denied errors

incidents.title: Storage Quota Exceeded - File Upload Service
incidents.impact: Users unable to upload new files for 15 minutes. Approximately 50 users affected. No data loss.
incidents.description: File upload service reached storage quota limit of 5TB. S3 bucket lifecycle policies were not configured correctly, preventing automatic deletion of old temporary files.
incidents.root_cause: S3 bucket lifecycle policy misconfiguration. Temporary files older than 30 days were not being automatically deleted as designed. This caused gradual storage accumulation until quota was exceeded.
incidents.resolution: Corrected S3 lifecycle policy configuration. Manually deleted expired temporary files (2.5TB). Increased quota to 10TB with auto-scaling enabled. Added proactive monitoring alerts at 75% and 90% capacity thresholds.
timeline: 11:30 - Emergency cleanup of temp files initiated
